com.here.android.mpa.routing

Class RoutePlan

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.routing.RoutePlan

  • public final class RoutePlan
extends java.lang.Object
    RoutePlan contains all information needed to calculate a Route. It can carry up to 32 waypoints, each of which is represented by a RouteWaypoint.

    However, the first and last waypoints used for route calculation must be of RouteWaypoint.Type.STOP_WAYPOINT type, otherwise, the error RouteManager.Error.INVALID_PARAMETERS will be returned.

    See Also:
    RouteWaypoint, RouteManager

    • Method Detail

      • addWaypoint

        @Deprecated
public RoutePlan addWaypoint(GeoCoordinate point)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use RoutePlan.addWaypoint(RouteWaypoint) instead.
        Adds a waypoint to the plan. Maximum 32 waypoints on a route.

        NOTE: Urban Mobility supports only 2 waypoints. If UMRouter is used, then adding more than 2 waypoints will result in getting an estimated Public Transport routes.

        Parameters:
        point - The GeoCoordinate waypoint to add.
        Returns:
        This RoutePlan object

      • addWaypoint

        public RoutePlan addWaypoint(RouteWaypoint point)
        Adds a waypoint to the plan. A maximum of 32 waypoints is allowed for a route.

        The first and last waypoints used for route calculation must be of RouteWaypoint.Type.STOP_WAYPOINT type.

        NOTE: Urban Mobility supports only 2 waypoints. If UMRouter is used, then adding more than 2 waypoints will result in getting an estimated Public Transport routes.

        Parameters:
        point - The RouteWaypoint representing the waypoint to add.
        Returns:
        This RoutePlan object

      • insertWaypoint

        @Deprecated
public RoutePlan insertWaypoint(GeoCoordinate point,
                                  int index)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use RoutePlan.insertWaypoint(RouteWaypoint, int) instead.
        Inserts a waypoint into a list of existing waypoints. The position of the new waypoint is according to the specified index. Maximum 32 waypoints on a route.

        NOTE: Urban Mobility supports only 2 waypoints. If UMRouter is used, then adding more than 2 waypoints will result in getting an estimated Public Transport routes.

        Parameters:
        point - The waypoint to insert
        index - The index in the range from 0 to the number of already existing waypoints.
        Returns:
        This RoutePlan object

      • insertWaypoint

        public RoutePlan insertWaypoint(RouteWaypoint point,
                       int index)
        Inserts a waypoint into a list of existing waypoints. The position of the new waypoint is according to the specified index. A maximum of 32 waypoints is allowed for a route.

        The first and last waypoints used for route calculation must be of RouteWaypoint.Type.STOP_WAYPOINT type.

        NOTE: Urban Mobility supports only 2 waypoints. If UMRouter is used, then adding more than 2 waypoints will result in getting an estimated Public Transport routes.

        Parameters:
        point - The waypoint to insert
        index - The index in the range from 0 to the number of already existing waypoints.
        Returns:
        This RoutePlan object

      • removeWaypoint

        public RoutePlan removeWaypoint(int index)
        Removes a waypoint at a specified index.

        The first and last waypoints used for route calculation must of be RouteWaypoint.Type.STOP_WAYPOINT type.

        Parameters:
        index - The zero-based index.
        Returns:
        This RoutePlan object

      • removeAllWaypoints

        public RoutePlan removeAllWaypoints()
        Removes all waypoints of the route plan.
        Returns:
        This RoutePlan object

        @Deprecated
public GeoCoordinate getWaypointAt(int index)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.2. Use RoutePlan.getWaypoint(int) instead.
        Gets geo-coordinates of the waypoint at a specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The zero-based index.
        Returns:
        the waypoint, null if the index submitted is out of bounds.

      • setRouteOptions

        public RoutePlan setRouteOptions(RouteOptions options)
        Sets the route options. This method does not retain a reference to options. If the options object is updated, then this method must be called again for the changes to be in effect.
        Parameters:
        options - The RouteOptions to set.

      • getRouteOptions

        public RouteOptions getRouteOptions()
        Gets a copy of the current route options used with this RoutePlan. Any changes made to the RouteOptions object returned by this method must be used to call RoutePlan.setRouteOptions(RouteOptions) again for the changes to be in effect.
        Returns:
        RouteOptions options associated with this plan.
